definition: success in satisfying a test or requirement, eliminate from the body, of advancing the ball by throwing it
details:
noun
- success in satisfying a test or requirement
= example: success in satisfying a test or requirement
= synonyms: passing, qualifying
- (sports) the act of throwing the ball to another member of your team
= example: (sports) the act of throwing the ball to another member of your team
= synonyms: flip, toss
- in baseball, an advance to first base by a batter who receives four balls
= example: in baseball, an advance to first base by a batter who receives four balls
= synonyms: base on balls, walk
- a flight or run by an aircraft over a target
= example: a flight or run by an aircraft over a target
- (American football) a play that involves one player throwing the ball to a teammate
= example: (American football) a play that involves one player throwing the ball to a teammate
= synonyms: passing, passing play, passing game
- a usually brief attempt
= synonyms: go, crack, fling, whirl, offer
- a complimentary ticket
= example: a complimentary ticket
- a permit to enter or leave a military installation
= example: a permit to enter or leave a military installation
= synonyms: liberty chit
- a document indicating permission to do something without restrictions
= example: a document indicating permission to do something without restrictions
= synonyms: laissez passer
- any authorization to pass or go somewhere
= example: any authorization to pass or go somewhere
= synonyms: passport
- you advance to the next round in a tournament without playing an opponent
= synonyms: bye
- one complete cycle of operations, as by a computer
= example: one complete cycle of operations, as by a computer
- a difficult juncture
= example: a difficult juncture
= synonyms: head, straits
- the location in a range of mountains of a geological formation that is lower than the surrounding peaks
= example: the location in a range of mountains of a geological formation that is lower than the surrounding peaks
= synonyms: notch, mountain pass
- a bad or difficult situation or state of affairs
= synonyms: strait, straits
- a written leave of absence from the military
= example: a written leave of absence from the military
verb
- eliminate from the body
= synonyms: excrete, egest, eliminate
- come to pass
= synonyms: come, hap, pass off, happen, go on, occur, fall out, come about, take place
- pass from physical life and lose all bodily attributes and functions necessary to sustain life
= synonyms: choke
- disappear gradually
= example: disappear gradually
= synonyms: fleet, fade, pass off, evanesce, blow over
- transmit information
= synonyms: communicate, pass on, pass along, put across
- grant authorization or clearance for
= synonyms: clear, authorise, authorize
- pass over, across, or through
= synonyms: draw, run, guide
- pass into a specified state or condition
= synonyms: lapse
- travel past
= example: travel past
= synonyms: overhaul, overtake
- go across or through
= example: go across or through
= synonyms: go through
- to move past
= example: to move past
= synonyms: go by, surpass, travel by, pass by, go past
- cause to pass
= example: cause to pass
= synonyms: make pass
- pass by
= synonyms: lapse
- transfer to another
= synonyms: communicate, convey, transmit
- be inherited by
= synonyms: return
- place into the hands or custody of
= synonyms: reach, hand, give, pass on, turn over
- throw (a ball) to another player
= example: throw (a ball) to another player
- allow to go without comment or censure
= example: allow to go without comment or censure
- make laws, bills, etc. or bring into effect by legislation
= example: make laws, bills, etc. or bring into effect by legislation
= synonyms: legislate
- go unchallenged
= synonyms: clear
- accept or judge as acceptable
= example: accept or judge as acceptable
- go successfully through a test or a selection process
= example: go successfully through a test or a selection process
= synonyms: make it
- be superior or better than some standard
= synonyms: top, exceed, go past, overstep, transcend
- stretch out over a distance, space, time, or scope

adjective
- of advancing the ball by throwing it
